alert.note: Alert for DuPage; Kane; Kendall; Northern Will; Southern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:14AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Kendall, northwestern Will, Kane and DuPage Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 513 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carpentersville to near Elburn to Leland. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Aurora, Joliet, Naperville, Elgin, Bolingbrook, Wheaton, Downers Grove, Lombard, Bartlett, Romeoville, Plainfield, Carpentersville, St. Charles, Woodridge, Oswego, Algonquin, Glen Ellyn, West Chicago, Batavia and Lockport. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 254 and 275. I-80 between mile markers 132 and 140. This includes... Argonne National Laboratory, University of St. Francis, Aurora University, Benedictine University, College of DuPage, DuPage County Fairgrounds, Elgin Community College, Fermilab, IL Math and Science Academy, Joliet Slammers Baseball, Kane County Cougars Ballpark, Lewis University, Morton Arboretum, Waubonsee Community College, Wheaton College, and North Central College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern Illinois.

area.areaDesc: DuPage; Kane; Kendall; Northern Will; Southern Cook
